channel.title: CAN'T SEARCH files, getting "Invalid Protocol" latest Whonix v12
channel.description:
Hi!
I just switched to the latest Whonix v12.0.0.3.2. For some reason I can't search files anymore (CTRL + F). I just receive an error saying "Invalid protocol".
Same error being discussed: [https://www.kubuntuforums.net/showthread.php?65461-Dolphin-find-tool-does-not-work-anymore-always-quot-invalid-protocol-quot](https://www.kubuntuforums.net/showthread.php?65461-Dolphin-find-tool-does-not-work-anymore-always-quot-invalid-protocol-quot)
If you take a look at the screenshot It's basically the same for me. I do not have "Desktop search" available at my system settings.
Please help.
/InvalidProtocol

item.title: CAN'T SEARCH files, getting "Invalid Protocol" latest Whonix v12
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Upstream bug report:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=766426

Summary, how to fix this:

sudo apt-get install baloo

And then wait a few moments. Search in dolphin will work then.

Will be fixed in Whonix 14 and above.

github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages

added baloo to anon-shared-applications-kde 

This fixes dolphin's search function.
Thanks to @invalidprotocol for the report!
http://forums.whonix.org/t/cant-search-files-getting-invalid-protocol-latest-whonix-v12
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=766426
by adrelanos on 11:21PM - 29 Jun 16
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

Read full topic
item.source: CAN'T SEARCH files, getting "Invalid Protocol" latest Whonix v12
